Dead Poets Society.plot: It is a movie in which a teacher inspires his students to look at the world with a more creative and open-minded perspective.
Dead Poets Society.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the students stood on their desks and proudly declared, "Oh captain, my captain!" to salute their teacher.

Tokyo Story.plot: It is a movie in which an aging couple visits their grown children in Tokyo, but are met with indifference and selfishness.
Tokyo Story.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the elderly parents are reunited with their children and grandchild at the end.

The Passion of Joan of Arc.plot: It is a movie in which the life and trial of French martyr Joan of Arc is recounted.
The Passion of Joan of Arc.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Joan of Arc refuses to sign a confession of heresy and is then taken away to be burned at the stake.

Hotel Rwanda.plot: It is a movie in which a hotel manager in Rwanda risks his life to save hundreds of refugees during the 1994 genocide.
Hotel Rwanda.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Paul Rusesabagina's wife, Tatiana, and their children finally arrive safely at the hotel after escaping the violence of the Rwandan genocide.

Ford v Ferrari.plot: It is a movie in which two determined men, Carroll Shelby and Ken Miles, attempt to build a revolutionary race car for Ford to compete in the 24 Hours of Le Mans race in 1966.
Ford v Ferrari.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Ken Miles is driving the Ford GT40 Mk II at the 24 Hours of Le Mans race and crosses the finish line with a broken valve spring.

Rocky.plot: It is a movie in which a small-time boxer gets a once-in-a-lifetime chance to fight the heavy-weight champion.
Rocky.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Rocky runs up the steps of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, lifting his arms in triumph at the top.

Platoon.plot: It is a movie in which a young soldier is put in charge of a platoon of the U.S. Army during the Vietnam War.
Platoon.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was the final battle scene where the platoon is attacked by a much larger enemy force.

Spotlight.plot: It is a movie in which a journalist investigates a case involving corruption and murder.
Spotlight.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the Boston Globe journalists were all gathered in the office to celebrate the success of their Spotlight investigation.

The Terminator.plot: It is a movie in which a cyborg assassin is sent back in time to kill a woman whose unborn son will lead humanity in a war against machines.
The Terminator.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the Terminator says "I'll be back" before leaving the police station in the first Terminator movie.

Ratatouille.plot: It is a movie in which a rat with a passion for cooking aspires to become a world-renowned chef in a famous restaurant.
Ratatouille.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Remy cooks the ratatouille dish for the food critic and he enjoys it, reminding him of his childhood.

Stand by Me.plot: It is a movie in which a group of boys embark on a journey of self-discovery as they search for a missing teenager.
Stand by Me.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the boys find the dead body and use their newfound bravery to give the body a proper burial.

Logan.plot: It is a movie in which a weary Logan (Hugh Jackman) cares for an ailing Professor X (Patrick Stewart) in a hideout on the Mexican border.
Logan.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Logan, Charles and Laura all share a touching moment as they are saying goodbye.

Rush.plot: It is a movie in which a small-town high school football team, led by its new coach, overcomes obstacles to win the state championship.
Rush.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when James Hunt and Niki Lauda race each other to the finish line in their Formula One cars.

Network.plot: It is a movie in which a computer hacker uncovers a plot to destroy the world's computer networks.
Network.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Howard Beale screams "I'M AS MAD AS HELL, AND I'M NOT GOING TO TAKE THIS ANYMORE!" through his window to the world.

Pather Panchali.plot: It is a movie in which a young girl's life in an Indian village is chronicled through the seasons.
Pather Panchali.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Durga and Apu go out to the nearby pond and Durga playfully races Apu as they make their way back home.

Into the Wild.plot: It is a movie in which a young man embarks on a journey of self-discovery in the Alaskan wilderness.
Into the Wild.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Chris McCandless (Emile Hirsch) gives away all of his money to a homeless man in a moment of pure selflessness and generosity.

The Wizard of Oz.plot: It is a movie in which a young girl named Dorothy and her dog Toto are transported to the magical world of Oz.
The Wizard of Oz.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Dorothy clicked her ruby red slippers together and said "there's no place like home" as she was whisked away to Kansas.

Before Sunset.plot: It is a movie in which two people who had a brief romantic encounter several years prior reunite and explore the possibility of starting a relationship.
Before Sunset.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Celine and Jesse are walking around Paris and discussing their relationship and current lives.

Groundhog Day.plot: It is a movie in which a man relives the same day over and over again.
Groundhog Day.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Phil Connors, played by Bill Murray, realises he is stuck on the same day and sings 'I Got You Babe' with Rita, played by Andie MacDowell.

The Best Years of Our Lives.plot: It is a movie in which three World War II veterans struggle to adjust to life after the war.
The Best Years of Our Lives.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Sgt. Al Stephenson and his wife, Milly, reunite and he breaks down in tears after being away from home for so long.

The Exorcist.plot: It is a movie in which a priest attempts to exorcise a demon from a young girl.
The Exorcist.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the priest was being dragged down the stairs by the possessed girl's invisible force.

To Be or Not to Be.plot: It is a movie in which a Shakespearean actor confronts the meaning of life and death.
To Be or Not to Be.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Jack and Maria are performing the play within the play, 'Heil Myself' and the audience is laughing hysterically.

The Incredibles.plot: It is a movie in which a family of superheroes works together to save the world.
The Incredibles.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the Incredibles family work together to defeat Syndrome and save the city.

La haine.plot: It is a movie in which three men from different social-economic backgrounds in Paris explore the tensions between different ethnic groups in the city.
La haine.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was the scene in the amusement park, when Vinz is about to shoot the police officer but then decides to throw the gun away.

The Battle of Algiers.plot: It is a movie in which Algerian revolutionaries fight for independence from French colonial rule.
The Battle of Algiers.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the Algerians march through the streets of Algiers singing the national anthem and waving their flags in celebration of their freedom.

Hachi: A Dog's Tale.plot: It is a movie in which a man forms an unbreakable bond with a lost dog he takes in.
Hachi: A Dog's Tale.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Hachi waited for his owner at the train station every day until his death, despite the passing of time.

Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of t.plot: It is a movie in which a blacksmith and a pirate embark on a quest to rescue the governor's daughter from cursed pirates.
Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of t.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Captain Jack Sparrow and his crew escape the cursed pirates by sailing over the edge of the world.

Jai Bhim.plot: It is a movie in which caste discrimination and inequality in India is explored through the life of a Dalit girl.
Jai Bhim.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Ambedkar, played by Prakash Jha, visits a village and addresses the people, inspiring them to stand up for their rights.

My Father and My Son.plot: It is a movie in which a father and son attempt to reconnect after years of estrangement.
My Father and My Son.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the father and son found a way to communicate with each other through the window of the prison.

The Grapes of Wrath.plot: It is a movie in which a family of sharecroppers is forced to leave their home in Oklahoma and travel to California during the Great Depression.
The Grapes of Wrath.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when the Joad family finally arrives at the California border after a long and arduous journey.

Amores Perros.plot: It is a movie in which three interconnected stories of love, family and dogfighting collide in Mexico City.
Amores Perros.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Octavio, after being beaten up by thugs, jumps into a pit of wild dogs and is saved by Cofi.

Rebecca.plot: It is a movie in which a Jewish student moves to a small town in the American South and experiences a culture clash.
Rebecca.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Max and Mrs. Danvers talk in the moonlight on the terrace at Manderley.

Cool Hand Luke.plot: It is a movie in which a man's quest for freedom is tested by an unrelenting prison system.
Cool Hand Luke.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Luke is in the middle of the road eating 50 eggs for a bet and the onlookers cheer him on.

The Handmaiden.plot: It is a movie in which a woman helps a pickpocket to swindle a wealthy heiress.
The Handmaiden.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Sook-Hee and Count Fujiwara were in the rain, and the Count finally realizes his love for her.

The 400 Blows.plot: It is a movie in which a young boy struggles to find acceptance as he is neglected and mistreated by his parents and society.
The 400 Blows.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Antoine runs away from home, realizing that he will never be understood or appreciated by his parents.

The Sound of Music.plot: It is a movie in which a young woman joins a family of seven children to become their governess in Austria during the Nazi era.
The Sound of Music.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Maria and the von Trapp family sing together at the top of the mountain as a way to escape the Nazis.

It Happened One Night.plot: It is a movie in which a spoiled heiress and a roguish journalist cross paths on a night-long journey of adventure and romance.
It Happened One Night.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Clark Gable's character, Peter, and Claudette Colbert's character, Ellie, hitch a ride on a bus, and Peter teaches her how to hitchhike.

Persona.plot: It is a movie in which a high school student discovers and unlocks a mysterious power to enter the collective unconscious.
Persona.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Elisabet Vogler and Alma are talking in the living room, and Alma notices that Elisabet is seemingly listening to her but not responding.

Life of Brian.plot: It is a movie in which a man named Brian is mistaken for a messiah.
Life of Brian.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Brian tells the crowd of people 'You've all got to work it out for yourselves!' and they all leave singing 'Always Look on the Bright Side of Life'.

Dersu Uzala.plot: It is a movie in which a Russian army explorer forms a bond with an indigenous hunter-gatherer in the 19th century.
Dersu Uzala.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Dersu Uzala and the captain share a moment of understanding as Dersu talks about his connection to the land and his way of life.

The Iron Giant.plot: It is a movie in which a young boy forms an unlikely friendship with a giant robot from outer space.
The Iron Giant.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was the moment when the Iron Giant sacrificed himself to save the town.

The Help.plot: It is a movie in which a young white woman forms an unlikely bond with two black maids in 1960s Mississippi.
The Help.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Skeeter stands up for Aibileen in the ladies' room at the country club and tells off Hilly for putting a 'help wanted' ad in the paper.

Aladdin.plot: It is a movie in which a street urchin discovers a magical lamp containing a powerful genie.
Aladdin.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Aladdin and Princess Jasmine take a magical ride on the magic carpet, soaring high above the city of Agrabah.

Gandhi.plot: It is a movie in which an Indian lawyer leads his people to independence from the British Empire.
Gandhi.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when Gandhi leads a peaceful march to the sea to make salt in defiance of the British-imposed salt tax.

Dances with Wolves.plot: It is a movie in which a soldier assigned to a remote outpost in the Dakotas befriends a tribe of Native Americans.
Dances with Wolves.most_memorable_scene: My favorite scene of the movie was when John Dunbar and his new Native American friends were riding through the snow-covered plains, celebrating their newfound friendship.
